Chap. 5 Promiſing them an Incorruptible Crown of Glory for their reward.

p.hi: What other Dutie is urged as Relative?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Reſpective carriage of Youngers towards their Elders.

p.hi: What more in General?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Humility, Confidence in God for his care of us, and a ſober vigilant Reſiſting the Devil.

p.hi: How doth the Epiſtle End?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: With an Holy Prayer for their being ſtrengthened in Faith; with ſome particular Salutations.

div.trailer: The End of the Firſt Epiſtle of S. PETER.

div.head: II. S. PETER.

p.hi: WHat is the beginning of this Epiſtle?

sp.p: An exhortation to labour after the Increaſe of Grace.

p.hi: With what Argument is that exhortation backed?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: With an aſſertion of the Truth of the Chriſtian Doctrine, it being divinely inſpired by the Holy Ghoſt to the Prophets.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: Doth not ſpeaking of the true Prophets, give occaſion to ſpeak of the falſe ones?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
Yes,
Chap. 2 the Apoſtle deſcribes what they were by bringing in Damnable Hereſies, and ſeveral other Characters of them; ſhewing the Danger of the adhering to their pernicious principles.

p.hi: How doth this Epiſtle End?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
With a Caution to Avoid their Tenets; and in order thereunto to grow in Grace,
Chap. 3 and in the Knowledge of Chriſt Jeſus our Saviour.

div.trailer: The End of the Second Epiſtle of S. PETER.

div.head: I. S. JOHN.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: WHat are the Contents of S. John's firſt Epiſtle?

sp.speaker: D.

div.trailer: The End of the Firſt Epiſtle of S. JOHN.

div.head: II. S. JOHN.

p.hi: WHat doth this Epiſtle Contain?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It being written to an Honourable Lady, the Apoſtle exhorts her and her Children to continue ſtedfaſt in the Faith, for fear of loſing the good Work; and the reward for them, to all that are ſound believers; and gives a Caution to avoid all ſeducers.

div.trailer: The End of the Second Epiſtle of S. JOHN.

div.head: III. S. JOHN.

p.hi: WHat are the Contents of this Third Epiſtle?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It is directed to Gaius an Holy and Hoſpitable Man; for which Vertues he is Commended; Diotrephes blamed for his Ambition in the Church; and Demetrius Applauded for his kindneſs.

div.trailer: The End of the Third Epiſtle of S. JOHN.

div.head: S. JUDE.

p.hi: WHat things doth this Epiſtle Treat of?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It begins with an Exhortation to continue Stedfaſt in the Faith, argued from the entering in of ſeveral who endeavoured to Corrupt it; by whoſe untoward Doctrine a great many were led aſide, whoſe wickedneſs the Apoſtle there Deſcribes, encouraging all the Diſciples of Chriſt not to be moved; and ſo concludes with a Thanksgiving to God for his Grace to all believers.

div.trailer: The End of the Epiſtle of S. JUDE.

div.head: REVELATION.

p.hi: VVHat is the laſt Book of the New Teſtament?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Revelation of S. John the Divine.

p.hi: Why is it ſo called?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Becauſe it Reveales what God had ſhewed by an Angel, unto S. John, concerning things which ſhould come to paſs.

p.hi: To whom was this Book directed?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: To the Seven Churches in Aſia.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: Where, and when was this Revelation made to S. John?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
It was made in the Iſle of Patmos;
Chap. 1 whither he was Baniſhed: and he had it on the Lords Day.

p.hi: How was it conveyed unto him?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: He heard behind him a great Voice as of a Trumpet.

p.hi: What did that Voice direct him to do?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: To write what he ſhould ſee in a Book, and ſend it to the ſeven Churches of Aſia; viz. Epheſus, Smirna, Pergamus, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea.

p.hi: What was the firſt Viſion?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Viſion of Seven Golden Candleſticks, in the midſt whereof walked One like the Son of Man, who had in his Right hand Seven Stars.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: What were thoſe Golden Candleſticks and Stars?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The ſeven Golden Candleſticks Repreſented the ſeven Churches: and the ſeven Stars the Angels of thoſe Churches.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: With which of theſe Churches doth S. John begin?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
With the Church of Epheſus.
Chap. 2

p.hi: Of what Nature is the Meſſage ſent to that Church?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It contains a Commendation for the ſufferings ſhe had endured; a Reproof for the Abatement of her Zeal, and an Exhortation to Repentance; with a Promiſe of Reward to him that ſhould overcome.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: What is the Meſſage to the Church of Smyrna?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: That to Smyrna and moſt of the reſt are of the ſame Nature with the former; convincing the People of what was blameworthy; Commending them for what was good, Exhorting them to Piety and Vertue.

p.hi: In which Epiſtles is there a Difference from the reſt?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
In thoſe two, to Philadelphia,
Chap. 3 and to Laodicea.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: What doth that to Philadelphia contain?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Only a Commendation of her Goodneſs, with promiſes thereupon.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: What doth that to Laodicea contain?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: A Reproof of her Luke-warmneſs; with a Threatening upon it, and good Counſel to turn unto God by Zeal and Repentance.

p.hi: What elſe doth this Book inform us of?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
Certain Predictions concerning the State of the Church in this World,
Chap. 4.5. and in the World to come.

sp.speaker: P.
sp.p: What are theſe concerning the Church in this World?
A Diſcovery of things to happen in the ſeveral Ages of the World, together with the Conqueſt of the Churches Enemies, but the way of this Diſcovery is very Abſtruſe and Myſterious.

p.hi: What concerns the State of the Church in the World to come.

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
The full Deſcription of the New Jeruſalem,
Chap. 21 where the Saints ſhall be for ever happy, ſet forth by ſome Myſterious Reſemblances.

p.hi: How doth this Book conclude?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
With a Confirmation of the Truth of this Propheſy,
Chap. 22 and the Churches earneſt deſire of Chriſts ſecond Coming to Judgment.

div.trailer: The End of the REVELATION.
